title: Bumi Resources Minerals says Palu operations unaffected by site closure

summary: The Public Housing and Settlements Ministry plans to transform parts of the long-stalled Meikarta project in Bekasi, West Java, into a subsidized apartment complex (Rusun) to provide affordable homes in urban areas for low-income earners.

title: Indonesia cuts live cattle price cap after beef traders’ strike
summary: Beef prices in Indonesia usually climb ahead of Idul Fitri, which is expected to fall on March 21 this year, as seasonal demand rises during Ramadan and the festive period.

title: Trump threatens Canada with 100% tariff if it completes China trade deal
summary: US President Donald Trump on Saturday warned Canada that if it concludes a trade deal with China, he will impose a 100 percent tariff on all goods coming over the border.

title: US business activity steady in January; consumer sentiment improves
summary: US business activity was steady in January as an improvement in new orders was offset by a lackluster labor market and lingering concerns among firms over higher costs because of import tariffs, a survey showed on Friday.

title: E-commerce sellers wait for tighter rules on platform fees
summary: E-commerce sellers say restrictions on platform fees under a planned new regulation would help them manage pricing more efficiently.

title: Gold nears $5,000, stocks muted after turbulent week
summary: Stocks were subdued and precious metals hit fresh highs Friday after a turbulent week that saw US President Donald Trump back down from threats to seize Greenland and to issue tariffs against European allies.

title: Indonesia seeks to boost rooftop solar quota by 400 MW
summary: If approved by state electricity monopoly PLN, the total quota for 2026 would rise to around 1,400 MW.

title: Prabowo vows stability, wider scrutiny of 'rapacious' firms in Davos keynote
summary: In his keynote speech at WEF 2026, the President painted the country as a "land of opportunity" while vowing to crack down on noncompliant businesses that continued to prop up the detrimental practice of "greednomics".

title: Danantara to deploy up to $14 billion this year, CIO says
summary: Half of Danantara's investments this year will go to public markets, largely in Indonesia, while it also evaluates opportunities in China, India, Japan, South Korea and Europe.

title: EU wants US trade deal back on track, but warns it would defend itself if threatened again
summary: EU leaders heaved a sigh of relief over Donald Trump’s U-turn on Greenland as they met for an emergency summit in Brussels late on Thursday.

title: Trump warns of 'big retaliation' if Europeans dump US Treasuries
summary: President Donald Trump warned Thursday of major reprisals if European countries dumped key holdings of US Treasury bonds to pressure Washington, as temperatures fluctuated over the future of Greenland.

title: IMF expects Indonesia’s economy to grow 5.1% this year
summary: Bank Indonesia, meanwhile, has projected Indonesia’s GDP to grow by around 5.3 percent year on year in 2026, supported by rising consumption and investment.

title: Danantara to break ground on waste-to-energy pilot projects in March
summary: The agency revealed that Jakarta and Tangerang, despite facing the country’s most severe waste problems, were left out of the initial pilots as local administrations have yet to indicate their readiness.

title: Prabowo secures $5.4b UK commitments, fishing boat project
summary: The President secured 4 billion pounds in investment commitments during his state visit to the UK, which included a meeting with the king on conservation initiatives, before departing to deliver his keynote at Davos.

title: South Korea economy unexpectedly contracts, but AI boom brightens outlook
summary: South Korea's economy unexpectedly shrank in the final quarter of 2025, marking the biggest slump in three years on weaker investment and exports, but the global AI boom is set to improve the outlook and allow the central bank to retain its steady rates stance.

title: Illegal tobacco excise plan casts haze over market fairness, policy certainty
summary: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa estimated that formalizing illegal cigarette production could generate additional trillions of rupiah (more than US$59 million) for the state coffers.

title: BI to remain ‘professional’ with strong governance, Perry vows
summary: Professionalism will continue in monetary policymaking, Bank Indonesia (BI) Governor Perry Warjiyo has promised, seeking to allay any concerns following Deputy Finance Minister Thomas “Tommy” Djiwandono’s nomination as a deputy BI governor.

title: AirAsia to launch direct Kuala Lumpur-Batam flights in March
summary: The addition brings the airline’s Malaysia-Indonesia network to 19 routes, which served nearly 3 million passengers last year.

title: Indonesia aims for garlic self-sufficiency in 2029
summary: Roughly 95 percent of the country’s consumption is currently met through imports.

title: Japan should respond 'decisively' to bond sell-off, opposition head says
summary: Japan should act decisively against excessive market moves, Yuichiro Tamaki, head of an influential opposition party, told Reuters on Wednesday, after a brutal sell-off of Japanese government bonds sent a chill through global financial markets.

title: Stocks stable after tariff-fueled selloff but uncertainty boosts gold
summary: Asian equities stabilized Wednesday after a rough start to the week fueled by Donald Trump's Greenland-linked tariff threats. Tokyo, Sydney, Singapore, Taipei and Manila fell, while Hong Kong, Shanghai and Jakarta rose.

title: Prabowo’s $6 billion rescue plan leaves textile industry puzzled
summary: A state-owned textile enterprise is to tackle industrywide problems, including rehiring tens of thousands of workers laid off after the Sritex bankruptcy.

title: Govt pledges central bank independence as rupiah hits record low
summary: Foreign investors sold a net roughly $6.4 billion worth of Indonesian government bonds in 2025, adding to the pressure on the currency.

title: Awaiting Indonesia’s electricity market reform
summary: The increasing costs of electricity purchased from IPPs, along with grid operation expenses, may lead to inflated state subsidies and compensation in the long run.

title: Visa-processing startup Spun bags $1.8m for regional expansion
summary: The company operates a platform that processes inbound and outbound visa applications using AI-enabled systems.

title: Vale Indonesia appeals nickel quota, says granted volume is too low
summary: Nickel miner PT Vale Indonesia is seeking approval to revise its annual production plan (RKAB) after revealing that its current ore production quota is insufficient to meet supply commitments for three major high-pressure acid leach (HPAL) projects.

title: Rupiah hits record low amid central bank independence worries
summary: The rupiah slid to Rp 16,985 per US dollar on Tuesday ahead of a policy decision by the central bank this week, where analysts expect the BI to stand pat on rates. The currency is down nearly 2 percent in January after dropping 3.5 percent in 2025.

title: Catch-up costs loom as Prabowo revives semiconductor dream
summary: The government has earmarked US$125 million for the development of a domestic chip design industry, with Coordinating Economy Minister Airlangga Hartarto citing a partnership with United Kingdom-based Arm Holdings.

title: Prabowo's nephew enters race for senior central bank post
summary: Deputy finance minister Thomas "Tommy" Djiwandono, who is also a nephew of President Prabowo Subianto, has been lined up to become a deputy governor of Bank Indonesia (BI), raising questions about the central bank’s independence.

title: Local governments propose 60 new transmigration areas
summary: Transmigration Minister M Iftitah Sulaiman Suryanagara has welcomed proposals from local governments to develop 60 transmigration areas in their respective regions.

title: RI tuna exports set for tariff-free access to Japan
summary: The Maritime Affairs and Fisheries Ministry is in the process of drafting a circular letter to ratify the agreement and outline registration procedures for accessing the zero-percent tariff.

title: Prabowo nominates nephew as central bank deputy governor, sources say
summary: Thomas Djiwandono, a deputy finance minister who is a former businessman, is reportedly set to face a fit-and-proper test by parliament for the new job.

title: EU scrambles to avert Trump Greenland tariffs, prepares retaliation
summary: Trump vowed on Saturday to implement a wave of increasing tariffs from February 1 on EU members Denmark, Sweden, France, Germany, the Netherlands and Finland, along with Britain and Norway, until the US is allowed to buy Greenland, a step major EU states decried as blackmail.

title: India's central bank proposes linking BRICS' digital currencies, sources say
summary: India's central bank has proposed that BRICS countries link their official digital currencies to make cross-border trade and tourism payments easier, two sources said, which could reduce reliance on the US dollar as geopolitical tensions rise.

title: Stocks, dollar take tariff hit; gold gets safety bid
summary: Stock markets slid in Asia on Monday after US President Donald Trump threatened to slap extra tariffs on eight European nations until the US was allowed to buy Greenland, pushing the dollar down against the safe-haven yen and Swiss franc.

title: Indonesia heading towards owning plasma fractionation plant
summary: Indonesia is set to host its first-ever plasma fractionation plant in Karawang, West Java, which is poised to become the largest such facility in Southeast Asia. This milestone marks a major step toward operational readiness, strengthening national healthcare resilience.

title: China's Q4 GDP growth slows to 3-year low, full-year pace meets official target
summary: China's economic growth slowed to a three-year low in the fourth quarter as domestic demand softened, and while the full-year pace hit Beijing's target, trade tensions and structural imbalances pose significant risks to the outlook.

title: Tourism industry warns year-end slowdown may spill into Idul Fitri
summary: The Indonesian Hotel and Restaurant Association (PHRI) reported that hotel occupancy rates fell by 4 percent last year compared with the previous year.

title: Kadin warns of slowing regional growth amid budget cuts
summary: At its 2026 economic outlook event on Jan. 15, Kadin cautioned against maintaining last year's budget policy to reduce regional transfers amid current global conditions, as doing so would only hamper local growth and exacerbate weakening demand.

title: Google asks US judge to defer order forcing it to share data while it appeals
summary: Alphabet's Google asked a judge on Friday to postpone making the company share data with rivals while it challenges a ruling that the company holds an illegal monopoly in online search, according to court papers.

title: Domestic investors dominated 2025 as FDI stagnated
summary: The investment minister said on Thursday that he expected further growth in domestic investment this year, particularly via funding channeled by Danantara.

title: Social media sites block 4.7 million underage accounts in Australia
summary: Initial figures showed platforms were taking meaningful action to remove underage users, Australia's eSafety Commissioner Julie Inman Grant said.

title: Musk dealt blow over Grok deepfakes, but regulatory fight far from over
summary: The climb-down by Musk, who initially laughed off the trend, highlights the difficulty of policing AI tools that make it cheap and easy to create explicit content. It is the latest clash between Europe and Musk, following rows over election interference, content moderation and free speech.

title: Indonesia tumbles in cybersecurity ranking
summary: Experts have called for a change in thinking among business leaders and regulators after Indonesia plummeted from position 48 to 84 in a global ranking of countries for cybersecurity.

title: US Supreme Court does not issue ruling on Trump's tariffs
summary: The US Supreme Court issued three decisions on Wednesday but did not decide the closely watched dispute over the legality of President Donald Trump’s global tariffs.

title: Beijing tells firms to stop using US, Israeli cybersecurity software, sources say
summary: Chinese authorities have told domestic companies to stop using cybersecurity software made by more than a dozen firms from the US and Israel due to national security concerns, three people briefed on the matter said.

title: Price gap, limited materials cloud biodiesel push
summary: An aggressive biodiesel push could pile pressure on energy subsidies in the state budget due to fluctuations in palm oil prices and squeeze already limited feedstock supplies that are also crucial for other industries.

title: West Java aims to swap Kertajati airport assets for stake in Bandung airport
summary: The West Java administration plans to give its stake in Kertajati International Airport in Majalengka to the central government and in return get a stake in Husein Sastranegara Airport in Bandung.

title: Sinar Mas Land’s Medical Suites supports an integrated healthcare system ecosystem
summary: As the government accelerates the transformation of the national healthcare sector through increased investment, medical technology innovation and the development of global-standard healthcare facilities, Sinar Mas Land presents Medical Suites, an international-standard medical building designed to support the development of healthcare services, research, medical education and leading medical practices.

title: Textile firms push for cheaper loans, tighter imports after $6b support pledge
summary: Coordinating Economy Minister Airlangga Hartarto said on Tuesday that President Prabowo Subianto had committed to the funding to keep technology competitive and sustain investment in the textile sector.

title: Indonesian ride-hailing industry set for shake-up under draft presidential decree
summary: Millions of Indonesian ride-hailing drivers would receive major increases to financial and social benefits under a draft decree being considered by President Prabowo Subianto, two sources said, threatening the profitability of ride-sharing platforms in their largest market in Southeast Asia.

title: Elon Musk's Grok faces global scrutiny for sexualized AI deepfakes
summary: X says it takes action against illegal content on the platform, including child sexual abuse material, by removing it, permanently suspending accounts, and working with local governments and law enforcement as necessary.

title: Canada to ratify trade deal with Indonesia before summer
summary: The Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) was signed in September last year during President Prabowo Subianto’s visit to Ottawa, marking a key milestone in Indonesia-Canada trade ties.

title: Asian stocks inch higher, fragile yen spurs intervention worries
summary: Asian stocks rose on Wednesday, buoyed by Japanese shares, as investors braced for a snap election in Japan that could lead to more fiscal stimulus, while worries about central bank independence and benign US inflation data whipsawed currencies.

title: OJK threatens ‘corrective measures’ as P2P defaults rise
summary: The default rate of peer-to-peer lending in the fintech industry has worsened, with the ratio of 90 days past due (TWP90) loans to total loans standing at 4.33 percent in November, up from 2.52 percent in November 2024, according to Financial Authority Services (OJK) data.

title: Gates Foundation appoints Sri Mulyani to governing board
summary: The former Indonesian’ finance minister’s appointment will bring valuable perspective thanks to her distinguished experience in economic and development policy, the foundation said.

title: Indonesia ‘not worried’ about US threat over trade with Iran
summary: Total bilateral trade with Iran stood at merely $206.9 million in 2023, according to the Trade Ministry.

title: Reduced import quota threatens beef supply, jobs, industry warns
summary: Industry associations are concerned about a drastic cut to this year's beef import quota for private companies, warning of potential layoffs, stymied domestic competition and negative impacts on the market and consumers.

title: Maintaining labor productivity in the manufacturing sector
summary: During the 2015-2024 period, wages grew by 16.1 percent in compound annual growth rate (CAGR), significantly outpacing productivity per worker, which increased by only 2.4 percent.

title: Prabowo launches $7.4b revamped Balikpapan refinery
summary: The long-awaited Balikpapan refinery upgrade, beset by multiple delays since the project broke ground in 2018, came onstream on Monday in a ceremony led by the President, with the energy ministry hailing the integrated facility's potential to significantly reduce fuel imports.

title: Asia stocks climb as Nikkei jumps to record, earnings loom
summary: A surge in Japanese shares led Asia higher on Tuesday amid investor bullishness over all things AI, while the cloud of uncertainty over Federal Reserve independence favored gold even as it weighed on the dollar.

title: Indonesia retail sales pick up but consumer confidence flatlines
summary: The retail sales index was projected to climb to 231.7 points in December while the consumer confidence index dropped slightly to 123.5 points.

title: AirAsia to launch Denpasar-Da Nang route in March
summary: The low-cost carrier's local branch is set to operate the new route connecting Bali and Vietnam four times weekly from mid-March as part of its strategy to expand regional connectivity.

title: Jakarta’s apartment supply sees steep decline in 2025
summary: A report from property consultancy Colliers Indonesia shows that only around 2200 units were added to the apartment supply in the capital last year, marking a significant drop from some 4,000 new units that had entered the market in 2024.

title: Indonesia car sales slide 7.2% in 2025 as weak demand persists
summary: Two-wheeler sales, meanwhile, reached 6.4 million units last year, marking a 1.3 percent rise from the year before.

title: Asian equities edge up, dollar slides as US Fed Reserve subpoenaed
summary: Asian equities posted gains Monday while the dollar dipped as investors digested news that the US Justice Department subpoenaed the Federal Reserve, raising fears over US central bank independence.
